greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Describe previous term from the right (method B - initial term is 8).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..21
example: The term after 1181 is obtained by saying "1 once, 8 once, 1 twice", which gives 118112.
program: f xs = (read $ concatMap show ys) : f ys where
ys = concat $ transpose [map head zss, map length zss]
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: More terms from _Patrick De Geest_, Jun 15 1999
